title: Everton eye Moussa Dembele transfer as replacement for Chelsea target Romelu Lukaku
text:
Romelu Lukaku is being strongly linked with a return to Chelsea (Picture: Getty) Everton are reportedly ready to rival the likes of Manchester United for the transfer of Celtic striker Moussa Dembele in a bid to replace Chelsea target Romelu Lukaku .
Arsenal legend reveals the frustrating reason Gunners ALWAYS flop in Europe The Toffees seem resigned to losing their top scorer in the summer, with the Belgium international reportedly eager on rejoining Chelsea in a £70million deal.
While the possibility of a top forward like Lukaku moving to an already strong Chelsea side is a frightening enough prospect for the rest of the Premier League, it could spell particularly bad news for United.
Moussa Dembele could replace Lukaku at Everton (Picture: Getty) The Red Devils have been linked with a move for Dembele as a cheap alternative to Atletico Madrid star Antoine Griezmann, but will now face competition from Everton, according to latest reports.
More: Football Chelsea on red alert as Koeman admits Everton could be forced to sell huge star 
Manchester United exile earns England recall along with Jermain Defoe 
Ronald Koeman fires warning to Romelu Lukaku amid Chelsea transfer links 
The Daily Express claims Everton have been scouting the Frenchman all season long and are ready to step up their interest in the player as they prepare to bank significant funds from Lukaku’s sale.
The 20-year-old looks an ideal like-for-like replacement for Lukaku, having scored 32 goals in all competitions this season and being blessed with superb natural technique, pace and power.
Dembele joined Celtic on a free transfer from Fulham last summer but could now fetch a transfer fee as high as £40million after his superb debut season in the Scottish Premiership.
